name: Romancing the Bible Quiz | Bible: Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the name of the temptress in Judges 16 (KJV) who stole Samson's strength and ultimately his life?
questions.explanation:
Delilah.

	Samson fell in love with Delilah while he was in the valley of Sorek. By using the words 'I love you' to Samson, Delilah was able to learn from Samson how to rid him of his strength. Samson's love for Delilah and her betrayal of that love ultimately led to Samson's death.

questions.text: According to Genesis 29 (KJV), Jacob served Laban fourteen years in order to marry Laban's daughter Leah.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Laban wanted Jacob to serve him seven years for Rachel, but at the end of seven years he was given Rachel's sister Leah as a wife. Jacob served Laban seven more years to get Rachel as his wife.

questions.text: What couple in Genesis 11-25 (KJV) stayed together through lies, adultery, and barrenness?
options: King Solomon and Queen of Sheba
questions.explanation:
Abraham and Sarah.

	Abraham and Sarah stayed with Abraham's father Terah until he died in Harran. When Abraham and Sarah moved to Egypt he lied about her being his wife to protect both of them. Abraham did this trick again with Abimelek. Abraham had his first son by Sarah's handmaid, Hagar, because Sarah was barren. God gave Sarah the ability to conceive and she gave Abraham his second son named Isaac when she was in her nineties. Sarah died at the age of one-hundred twenty-seven while Abraham died at the age of one-hundred seventy-five.

questions.text: For how much money in Hosea 3 (KJV) did Hosea buy his prostitute wife, Gomer?
questions.explanation:
Hosea bought Gomer for 15 shekels.

	The Lord told Hosea to marry and have children with the prostitute named Gomer. Hosea bought her for 15 shekels. Together, Hosea and Gomer had three daughters.

questions.text: Along with a parcel of land that Boaz purchased from Naomi, what else did Naomi give Boaz, according to Ruth 4 (KJV)?
questions.correct: Naomi gave Boaz her daughter-in-law, Ruth
options: Naomi gave Boaz her daughter-in-law, Orpah
Naomi gave Boaz herself in a gift of marriage
Naomi gave Boaz all her worldly possessions
questions.explanation:
Naomi gave Boaz her daughter-in-law, Ruth.

	The land Boaz purchased from Naomi belonged to her husband Elimelech and their two deceased sons Chilion and Mahlon. In order to keep the land in the family, Boaz married Mahlon's widow, Ruth. Together, Boaz and Ruth had a son named Obed.

questions.text: From I Samuel 18 (KJV), which one of David's wives did he kill two hundred Philistines to marry?
questions.explanation:
Michal.

	David wanted Saul's daughter, Michal, as his wife, but in order to marry her David had to do what Saul requested. Saul's request was for David to kill two hundred Philistines and bring him their foreskins. Saul believed David would die in the attempt and he would not have to give Michal to David in marriage. David returned to Saul with the two-hundred foreskins and Saul had no choice but to give his daughter in marriage. When Saul saw that Michal truly loved David, he became more fearful of David.

questions.text: According to Luke 2 (KJV), this man made the ultimate romantic gesture when he married his girlfriend who was pregnant by someone else and took her back to his hometown. What was the  name of the couple who shared a room in a barn?
questions.explanation:
Mary and Joseph.

	Joseph and a very pregnant Mary travelled to Joseph's hometown of Bethlehem because of a taxation brought about by Caesar Augustus. While they were there, Mary gave birth to Joseph's stepson, Jesus. Jesus learned his stepfather's trade of carpentry while living with his mother and father.

questions.text: According to Genesis 21 (KJV), how was Ishmael's wife chosen?
questions.correct: Ishmael's wife was chosen by his mother, Hagar
options: Ishmael's wife was chosen by his stepmother, Sarah
Ishmael played woman against each other for his hand in marriage
Ishmael's wife was chosen by his father, Abraham
questions.explanation:
Ishmael's wife was chosen by his mother, Hagar.

	Hagar and Ishmael were living in the desert of Paran when Hagar went to Egypt to find Ishmael a wife. Together, Ishmael and his wife had twelve sons and one daughter.

questions.text: In the book of Genesis 2 (KJV), from which bone in Adam's body did God create Adam's helpmate, Eve?
questions.correct: God used Adam's rib bone to create Eve
options: God used Adam's knee bone to create Eve
God used Adam's shin bone to create Eve
God used Adam's clavicle to create Eve
questions.explanation:
God used Adam's rib bone to create Eve.

	When Adam awoke to find Eve with him, he said that Eve was now 'bone of my bones and flesh of my flesh'.

questions.text: According to Acts 5 (KJV), what married couple did God kill three hours apart from each other for lying to Him?
questions.explanation:
Ananias and Sapphira.

	Ananias and Sapphira sold a piece of their property and kept part of the money from the sale while giving the other part to Peter. When Peter questioned Ananias about the entire amount of the money, Ananias lied to him about keeping part of the money. Ananias died on the spot. Three hours later when Sapphira went looking for Ananias, she found Peter. When Peter asked her about the entire amount of the money for the property sale, Sapphira lied too. She died instantly.
